byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Obama administration says it will shift $81 million in funding away from biomedical research and antipoverty health care programs to fund development of Zika vaccine; failure of Congress to approve Zika funding has forced extraordinary move.
snippet: The Obama administration said $81 million will be shifted to the development of a Zika vaccine, citing a failure by Congress to approve new funding....

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said $81 million will be shifted to the development of a Zika vaccine, citing a failure by Congress to approve new funding.

headline.main: With Congress Deadlocked, White House Diverts Funds to Fight Zika
headline.print_headline: White House Diverts Funds to Help Find Zika Vaccine
